isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE (with R-134a Refrigerant System) - DESCRIPTION OF SYSTEM COMPONENTS - REFRIGERANT LOW PRESSURE SWITCH

svcproc.title: REFRIGERANT LOW PRESSURE SWITCH

figure.caption: Figure 18. Refrigerant Low Pressure Switch (Typical Locations)

svcproc.para: A low pressure switch is used to protect the compressor. It is located in the refrigerant return line and prevents compressor operation if the refrigerant level is too low. Low refrigerant also means low lubricant and can result in compressor damage. The low pressure switch may be located on the expansion valve or at the outlet of the evaporator.

When the system operates, normal system pressure holds the switch open. If system low pressure (compressor suction) gets too low, the switch closes, energizing a relay that opens the circuit to the compressor magnetic clutch and stops operation of the compressor. Refer to SPECIFICATIONS for the opening and closing pressures of this switch.
